question: Trinity represents Father, Son, and Holy Spirit.
Ten Commandments were given in Exodus.
Beatitudes are found in Gospel of Matthew.
Peter was the rock or foundation of church.
Repentance means turning away from sin toward God.
Jesus Christ is believed to be the Son of God.
Forgiveness in Christianity means pardoning sins.
Crucifixion is central to Christian theology.
Redemption means being saved through Jesus.
Witness in Christianity means testifying to faith.
Last Supper symbolizes covenant and sacrifice.
Salvation is through both faith and works.
Paul's mission was to the Gentiles.
Sermon on Mount teaches Jesus' ethical principles.
Epistles are letters written by Paul.
Pentecost is when Holy Spirit descended on disciples.
Ten Commandments were given to Moses.
Christian teaching emphasizes love and charity.
Parables are stories teaching moral lessons.
Jesus taught and healed everyone including the poor.
Apostles were the twelve followers of Jesus.
Holy Spirit descends upon believers at baptism.
Resurrection of Jesus is celebrated on Easter.
Christianity is based on the Bible.
